column4: Abercrombie settlement wins court approval after earlier rejection
column5: A federal judge on Tuesday approved a revised settlement of a lawsuit challenging former Abercrombie & Fitch Co Chief Executive Michael Jeffries' pay  three months after rejecting a version that appeared to offer few benefits and release too many potential claims.

column4: UPDATE 1-Zambia mines minister says mining royalty hike will remain
column5: LUSAKA  Dec 30 Zambia will hike royalty rates on open pit and underground mining beginning on Thursday  the country's mines minister said on Tuesday  despite industry concerns of shaft closures and up to 12 000 in job losses.

column4: BP says reviewed forex desk in light of regulatory probe
column5: BP reviewed the activities of its in-house foreign exchange traders  the British oil and gas group said on Tuesday  after the Financial Times reported that BP was investigating whether its traders were involved in rigging the currency market.

column4: Key House Republican spoke to white nationalist group in 2002: report

column4: Court orders Argentina's YPF to disclose contract with Chevron

column4: China's Sinopec says oil price slump won't halt shale gas development
column5: BEIJING China's Sinopec Corp said on Monday it was committed to shale gas spending for 2015 despite a sinking global oil market to which domestic gas prices are linked.

column4: Foreign automakers taken to task in China over dealers' bloated inventories
column5: SHANGHAI Foreign automakers in China may struggle to dictate sales goals in the future after dealers complained to the government that inflexible targets set during a market boom obliged them to buy too much stock and bear the brunt of a drop in demand.

column4: Foreign automakers taken to task in China over dealers' bloated inventories
ICE gets tough on 'disruptive trading' practices
column5: Dec 30 Intercontinental Exchange Inc  will prohibit disruptive trading practices in its futures marketplace  as it looks to tackle an illegal manipulative trading strategy known as "spoofing".

column4: In-store pickup does not save U.S. shoppers much time -study
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 29 Major U.S. retailers including Target Corp and Toys 'R Us have begun allowing shoppers to collect online purchases at their brick-and-mortar stores  but a study shows the option often saves little  if any  time over in-store shopping.

column4: DOJ targeting Morgan Stanley's relationship with subprime lender: NYT
column5: The U.S. Department of Justice is examining the relationship between Morgan Stanley and now-defunct New Century Financial Corp in the sale of subprime mortgages in the run-up to the financial crisis  New York Times reported.

column4: U.S. says Noble Energy deal should move forward  boosts energy security
